newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices regain ground on export news.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices regain ground on export news.

text.p: Indian cotton prices regained ground on Tuesday on speculative buying following reports the Indian government may allow more cotton exports, traders said.

They said the authorities were considering a proposal to allow more exports and a decision was expected soon. In spot deals Gujarat Kalyan rose by 300/400 rupees to 13,600/13,700 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) while wagad cotton gained by 400/500 rupees to 11,700 rupees per candy. Punjab saw-ginned moved up by 20/25 rupees to 1,700 rupees per maund (37.32 kg).
Bengal-deshi ready delivery rose by 5/15 rupees to 840/865 rupees per maund and October delivery by 50 to 900 rupees.
